result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(c).
  • Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated August 17, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2017AP000238 CRNM (2014CF005590 and 2017AP000239 CRNM (2015CF000228), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on July 2, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of convictions are summarily affirmed.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Jensen is relieved of further represention of Robert C. Brown in these matters.

records.addlTxt: per order dated July 2, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2017AP238-CRNM (2014CF5590) and 2017AP239-CRNM (2015CV228), IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Jensen is relieved of further representation of Robert C. Brown in these matters. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. PSI reviewed. Statements by parties, defendant, and April M. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 30 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1 in case 14CF5590 and any other sexual assault count, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 40 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1 in case 14CF5590 and any other sexual assault count, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 30 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count 2, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 45 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1 in case 14CF5590 and any other sexual assault count, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 30 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 5
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count 4, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 6
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count 4, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 7
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 35 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1 in case 14CF5590 and any other sexual assault count, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 25 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 8
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count 9 and consecutive to Count 7, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 9
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count 8 and consecutive to Count 7, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 10
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 40 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1 in case 14CF5590 and any other sexual assault count, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 30 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 11
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count 10, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 12 AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 15 YEARS, concurrent to Count 10, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

-COURT ORDERED ALL COUNTS CONCURRENT TO REVOCATION ON CASE 10CF3402.

-Court ordered the defendant to pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds during sentence, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm, body armer, or ammunition possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

When the clerk was inventorying the exhibits from jury trial, exhibit #48, a DNA report, could not be located.  All exhibits were gone through twice, the court files were reviewed and both the state and defense counsel were contacted to check their files to see if the report had been put in their file in error.
As report was not found, the clerk emailed counsels to see if there would be an objection to marking an exact copy of the report as exhibit #48.  There was no objection by ADA Ballenger or Attys Epps and Sargent.  The state provided a clean copy of the report to be marked.
Substanative jury instructions received and filed.

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorneys Steve Sargent and Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger and Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Ofc. Amy Stolowksi, MPD. All jurors present at 9am to resume deliberations. Jury submitted a question to the court, however, prior to response advised that verdicts had been reached. Jury in the box at 10:20. Upon review of verdicts submitted, the court returns panel to jury room to clarify dates on verdicts. At the hour of 10:30am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, number 8, the following verdicts were read:
Case 14CF5590:
Count 1: First degree sexual assault (use of a dangerous weapon), GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 2: Kidnapping , GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 3: Armed robbery, GUILTY (6/17/15).
Case 15CF228:
Count 1 (referenced as count 4): Second degree sexual assault of a child, GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 2 (referenced as count 5): First degree sexual assault of a child, GUILTY (6/18/15).
Count 3 (referenced as count 6): Kidnapping, GUILTY (6/18/15).
Count 4 (referenced as count 7): First degree sexual assault (use of a dangerous weapon), GUILTY (6/18/15).
Count 5 (referenced as count 8): Armed Robbery, GUILTY (6/18/15).
Count 6 (referenced as count 9): Kidnapping, GUILTY (6/18/15).
Count 7 (referenced as count 10): First degree sexual assault (use of a dangerous weapon), GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 8 (referenced as count 11): Attempted armed robbery, GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 9 (referenced as count 12): Kidnapping, GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 10 (referenced as count 13): First degree sexual assault (use of a dangerous weapon), GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 11 (referenced as count 14): Kidnapping, GUILTY (6/17/15).
Count 12 (referenced as count 15): Attempted armed robbery, GUILTY (6/17/15).
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction. Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and cannot possess any firearms or body armor and his civil rights are suspended until they are restored. Court will order the PSI.  Defense asks for no recommendation on PSI. Defendant remanded pending sentencing. Case is adjourned for sentencing in Br. 38. Br. 38 will retain case for sentencing. All parties are advised to appear in room 504 of the courthouse on sentencing date.

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorneys Louis Edward Epps and Steve Sargent.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger and Erin Karshen
Jury in the box at 8:56am.  
Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Ofc. Amy Stolowski (previously sworn), MPD, Ofc. Justin Carloni, MPD, Ofc. Jolene Reyes, MPD, Michelle Burns (previously sworn), forensic DNA analyst, Wisconsin State Crime Lab, Det. Steve Wells, MPD.
Jury out of the box at 10:30am.
Jury in the box at 10:42am.
B.H.W. (DOB 7/5/97), Det. Rodney Gonzalez (MPD), Christina Hildebrand, SANE, Aurora Sinai, Ofc. Joan Mueller, MPD. State recalls Jolene Reyes (previously sworn), Michelle Burns (previously sworn).
Exhibits 70, 72, 49-53, 55, 71, 60, 59, 56, 54, 4, 40, 42, 73, 62-69, 76, 77, 61, 74, 75 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 11:52. 
Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Defendant waives right to testify and defense submits written waiver. Parties stipulate to jury instructions and verdict forms. Court recessed for lunch.
All parties present in court at 1pm.
Jury in the box at 1:12.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state. Jury out of the box at 2:33.
Jury in the box at 2:41pm. Closing arguments made by defense. Rebuttal argument made by state.  
Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror (5) selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:48pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Scott Pelowski and Mark Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Jury released for the day at 4:40 to return and continue deliberating at 8:45am on 6/18/15.  Jury trial scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps and Stephen Sargent.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger and Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.  Matters will be proceeding to trial. Court will impanel a jury of 13, each side will have 5 strikes.
The court will be referring to the 2 cases in consecutive numerical order for purposes of identifying counts to the jury. Case 14CF5590 counts 1,2,3 and Case 15CF228 counts 4 through 15.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:00am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Court recessed for lunch and directed all parties to appear back at 1:00pm. 
All parties are in court at 1:00pm. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury in the box at 1:05pm and sworn.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state(ADA Ballenger) and defense(Atty Epps).  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Brianna B.; Anita B.; PO Amy Stolowski(MPD).
Court recesses for the day and orders jury and counsels to appear at 8:40 on 6-16-2015.  In chambers discussion held.

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps and Stephen Sargent.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger and Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state has filed an AMENDED INFORMATION as to count 12 only adding the ATTEMPT statute of 939.32, for a charge of Attempt Armed Robbery, Repeater.
All other counts remain the same.
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $187.50 to Dr. Collins for services on 03/23, 04/13 of 2015

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps and Stephen Sargent.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Erin Karshen will act as co-chair for trial.
Cases remain firm for trial on June 15.  The defense will not be filing any  alibi or rape shield motions.  The state has conveyed offers for resolution. The court directs parties that if cases are to resolve short of trial it must be done by June 11 in the morning.
State's AMENDED Proposed Jury Instructions/verdict forms filed
The defense has not filed any motions as was indicated on 4-30-2015.
Proposed Jury Instructions filed by the state.
filed by the state

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps and Steve Sargent.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has not filed any motions.  State informs the court and counsels that witnesses have been subpoenaed for trial and it will be prepared to proceed on June 15.  Defense states that it may be filing an alibi witness list and will do so within the required time limit.
Defense is conducting an investigation into whether 2 of the victims had a previous sexual relationship with the defendant and will provide information to the state by May 8, 2015.  The state will have until May 15, 2015 to file a response, as well as any issues related to Motion in Limine.
The court will conduct another final pretrial on 6-3-2015 at 8:15.
Defendant's Jury Instructions

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps and Steve Sargent.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reports of Dr. Collins are reviewed by all parties.  There are no challenges to the reports by the state or defense/defendant.  The court adopts the opinion of Dr. Collins that to a reasonable degree of professional certainty the defendant is competent to proceed.  Dr. Collins does not find that to a reasonable degree of professional certainty that an NGI plea can be supported.
Atty Epps informs the court that the defense had retained the services of Dr. Jurek to examine the defendant as to competency and NGI, however, the reports will not be filed with the court.  The opinion of Dr. Jurek, to a reasonable degree of medical certainty is the defendant is competent and does not support an NGI plea.
The defense filed a WAIVER OF MIRANDA-GOODCHILD which is accepted by the court as being knowing and  voluntary.  The defense will not be challenging the search of premises.  Defense may file a motion pertaining to prior sexual contact between the defendant and 2 of the alleged victims.  The state requests that it be notified as soon as possible of that filing.
The state informs the court that it will have approximately 25 witnesses for trial.
The court will vacate the 4-27-2015 motion date and will set the FPT for 4-30-2015.
Report of Dr. Collins dated April 13, 2015, received and filed.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Robert C Brown not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven Sargent also appears for the defendant.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.
The defense is requesting a new trial date due to the voluminous discovery.  The state has no objection.  The court will vacate the current trial date of 4-27-2015 and convert to a final pretrial and motion date and will hear additional motions on 4-30-2015 if needed.  ALL MOTIONS TO BE FILED BY 4-6-2015.  The new trial date is 6-15-2015 at 8:15.

Clerk contacted the Forensic Unit to find out availability for Dr. Collins on April 10 to testify.  Dr. is out of town April 8, 9, 10.  Clerk set return of report/hearing on 4-14-2015 at 8:30am.  Clerk emailed ADA Ballenger and Atty Epps as to date change.
for NGI exam

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Report of Dr. Collins dated 3-18-2015 has been provided to court and counsels.  Atty Epps states that defense doctor, Dr. Jurek, has not been able to complete his evaluation of the defendant yet and also that an NGI evaluation is being done.  Defense is unable to agree or challenge the report of Dr. Collins until its expert has finished its exam.
The court will appoint Dr. Collins to conduct and NGI exam and will set matter for a return of report date and a hearing on the reports.  The trial date of 4-27-2015 is to stand as is the final pretrial on 3-27-2015.  Return of report/hearing is set for 4-10-2015 at 8:30am.
Notice of Intent to Use DNA at Trial filed by the state.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Robert C Brown not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state informs the court that the last DNA report was sent to defense on 2-25-2015.  The completed discovery as to all victims is to be done by end of next week.
for Competency Exam

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Atty Epps advises that he will be having Dr. Jurik examine the defendant as to competency as well as Forensic Unit.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Case is adjourned to 3-19-2015 at 8:15 for return of report.
Also, court will set a status date of 2-27-2015 at 8:15 to assure that all DNA reports have been received.

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Robert C Brown in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Robert C Brown in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed yesterday.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to all counts.  
Defendant has pending case, 14CF5590, which the state will be moving to join with this matter.  Defendant has a VOP hold.
Court will set a motion for joinder on 2-19-2015.  
Defense states that there is 500 pages of discovery to be reviewed as well as crime lab results to receive.  The state informs the court that testing is to be completed within 2 weeks.  Court directs the state to contact the crime lab and give a deadline for results to be returned.
The court will sign ORDERS as to HIV and STD testing of the defendant and the results are only to be returned to the victim's parents.  The state has filed a Notice of Intent to Use DNA at Trial.
Case set for final pretrial on 3-27-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 4-27-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 2-23-2015.
